sketch by boz illustrative of day life day people by charles dickens with illustration by george cruickshank phiz london chapman hall ld new york charles scribners son preface whole of sketch be written published one by one when be very young man be collected republished while be still very young man sent into world with imperfection good many on head comprise first attempt at exception of certain tragedy achieved at mature age of eight ten represented with great applause to overflowing nursery be conscious of often being extremely crude ill considered bearing obvious mark of haste inexperience particularly in section of present volume be comprised under general head of tale a collection be not originated now be very leniently favourably received when be first made have not felt right either to remodel expunge beyond few word phrase here there parish chapter ithe beadle parish engine schoolmaster how much be conveyed in two short wordsthe parish with how many tale of distress misery of broken fortune ruined hope too often of unrelieved wretchedness successful knavery be associated poor man with small earnings large family just manages to live on from hand to mouth to procure food from day to day have barely sufficient to satisfy present craving of nature can take heed of future tax be in arrear quarter day pass by quarter day arrives can procure more quarter for be summoned bythe parish good be distrained child be cry with cold hunger very bed on sick wife be lying be dragged from beneath what can do to whom be to apply for relief to private charity to benevolent individual certainly notthere be parish there be parish vestry parish infirmary parish surgeon parish officer parish beadle excellent institution gentle kind hearted men woman diesshe be buried by parish child have protectorthey be taken care of by parish man first neglect afterwards can not obtain workhe be relieved by parish when distress drunkenness have done work upon be maintained harmless babbling idiot in parish asylum parish beadle be one of most perhaps most important member of local administration be not so well off a churchwarden certainly be so learned a vestry clerk doe order thing quite so much own way a of power be very great notwithstanding dignity of office be never impaired by absence of effort on part to maintain beadle of parish be splendid fellow be quite delightful to hear a explains state of existing poor law to deaf old woman in board room passage on business night to hear what said to senior churchwarden what senior churchwarden said to what beadle other gentleman came to determination of doing miserable looking woman be called into boardroom represents case of extreme destitution affecting herselfa widow with six small child where do live inquires one of overseer rent two pair back gentleman at mr brown number little king williams alley have lived there fifteen year know to be very hard working industrious when poor husband be alive gentleman a died in hospitalwell well interrupt overseer taking note of address ill send simmons beadle to morrow morning to ascertain whether story be correct if so suppose must have order into housesimmons go to woman first thing to morrow morning will simmons bow assent usher woman out previous admiration of board who sit behind great book with hat on fade into nothing before respect for lace trimmed conductor account of what have passed inside increasesif that be possiblethe mark of respect shown by assembled crowd to solemn functionary a to taking out summons hopeless case if simmons attends on behalf of parish know title of lord mayor by heart state case without single stammer be even reported that on one occasion ventured to make joke lord mayor head footman who happened to be present afterwards told intimate friend confidentially be almost equal to one of mr hoblers see again on sunday in state coat cocked hat with large headed staff for show in left hand small cane for use in right how pompously marshal child into place how demurely little urchin look at askance a survey when be seated with glare of eye peculiar to beadle churchwarden overseer being duly installed in curtained pew seat on mahogany bracket erected expressly for at top of aisle divide attention between prayer book boy suddenly just at commencement of communion service when whole congregation be hushed into profound silence broken only by voice of officiating clergyman penny be heard to ring on stone floor of aisle with astounding clearness observe generalship of beadle involuntary look of horror be instantly changed into one of perfect indifference a if be only person present who have not heard noise artifice succeeds after putting forth right leg now then a feeler victim who dropped money venture to make one two distinct dive after beadle gliding softly round salute little round head when again appears above seat with diver double knock administered with cane before noticed to intense delight of three young men in adjacent pew who cough violently at interval until conclusion of sermon such be few trait of importance gravity of parish beadlea gravity have never be disturbed in case have come under observation except when service of particularly useful machine parish fire engine be required then indeed be bustle two little boy run to beadle a fast a leg will carry report from own personal observation that neighbouring chimney be on fire engine be hastily got out plentiful supply of boy being obtained harnessed to with rope away rattle over pavement beadle runningwe exaggeraterunning at side until arrive at house smelling strongly of soot at door of beadle knock with considerable gravity for hour attention being paid to manual application turn cock having turned on water engine turn off amidst shout of boy pull up once more at work house beadle pull up unfortunate householder next day for amount of legal reward never saw parish engine at regular fire once came up in gallant stylethree mile half hour at least there be capital supply of water be first on spot bang went pumpsthe people cheeredthe beadle perspired profusely be unfortunately discovered just a be going to put fire out that nobody understood process by engine be filled with water that eighteen boy man have exhausted in pumping for twenty minute without producing slightest effect personage next in importance to beadle be master of workhouse parish schoolmaster vestry clerk a everybody know be short pudgy little man in black with thick gold watch chain of considerable length terminating in two large seal key be attorney generally in bustle at time more so than when be hurrying to parochial meeting with glove crumpled up in one hand large red book under other arm a to churchwarden overseer exclude altogether because know of be that be usually respectable tradesman who wear hat with brim inclined to flatness who occasionally testify in gilt letter on blue ground in conspicuous part of church to important fact of gallery having being enlarged beautified organ rebuilt master of workhouse be not in parishnor be usually in otherone of class of men better part of whose existence have passed away who drag out remainder in inferior situation with just enough thought of past to feel degraded by discontented with present be unable to guess precisely to own satisfaction what station man can have occupied before must think have be inferior sort of attorney clerk else master of national schoolwhatever be be clear present position be change for better income be small certainly a rusty black coat threadbare velvet collar demonstrate then life free of house rent have limited allowance of coal candle almost unlimited allowance of authority in petty kingdom be tall thin bony man always wear shoe black cotton stocking with surtout eye a pas parlour window a if wished be pauper just to give specimen of power be admirable specimen of small tyrant morose brutish ill tempered bullying to inferior cringing to superior jealous of influence authority of beadle schoolmaster be just very reverse of amiable official have be one of men one occasionally hears of on whom misfortune seems to have set mark nothing ever did be concerned in appears to have prospered rich old relation who have brought up openly announced intention of providing for left l in will revoked bequest in codicil thus unexpectedly reduced to necessity of providing for procured situation in public office young clerk below died off a if there be plague among old fellow over head for reversion of whose place be anxiously waiting lived on on a if be immortal speculated lost speculated again wonbut never got money talent be great disposition easy generous liberal friend profited by one abused other loss succeeded loss misfortune crowded on misfortune successive day brought nearer verge of hopeless penury quondam friend who have be warmest in profession grew strangely cold indifferent have child whom loved wife on whom doted former turned back on latter died broken hearted went with streamit have ever be failing have not courage sufficient to bear up against so many shockshe have never cared for only being who have cared for in poverty distress be spared to no longer be at period that applied for parochial relief kind hearted man who have known in happier time chanced to be churchwarden that year through interest be appointed to present situation be old man now of many who once crowded round in hollow friendship of boon companionship have died have fallen like have prosperedall have forgotten time misfortune have mercifully be permitted to impair memory use have habituated to present condition meek uncomplaining zealous in discharge of duty have be allowed to hold situation long beyond usual period will no doubt continue to hold until infirmity render incapable death release a grey headed old man feebly pace up down sunny side of little court yard between school hour must be difficult indeed for most intimate of former friend to recognise once gay happy associate in person of pauper schoolmaster chapter iithe curate old lady half pay captain commenced last chapter with beadle of parish because be deeply sensible of importance dignity of office will begin present with clergyman curate be young gentleman of such prepossessing appearance fascinating manner that within one month after first appearance in parish young lady inhabitant be melancholy with religion other half desponding with love never be so many young lady seen in parish church on sunday before never have little round angel face on mr tomkinss monument in side aisle beheld such devotion on earth a exhibited be about five twenty when first came to astonish parishioner parted hair on centre of forehead in form of norman arch wore brilliant of first water on fourth finger of left hand always applied to left cheek when read prayer have deep sepulchral voice of unusual solemnity innumerable be call made by prudent mamma on new curate innumerable invitation with be assailed to do justice readily accepted if manner in pulpit have created impression in favour sensation be increased tenfold by appearance in private circle pew in immediate vicinity of pulpit reading desk rose in value sitting in centre aisle be at premium inch of room in front row of gallery must not be procured for love money people even went so far a to assert that three miss brown who have obscure family pew just behind churchwarden be detected one sunday in free seat by communion table actually lying in wait for curate a passed to vestry began to preach extempore sermon even grave papa caught infection got out of bed at half past twelve oclock one night to half baptise washerwoman child in slop basin gratitude of parishioner knew boundsthe very churchwarden grew generous insisted on parish defraying expense of watch box on wheel new curate have ordered for to perform funeral service in in wet weather sent three pint of gruel quarter of pound of tea to poor woman who have be brought to bed of four small child at oncethe parish be charmed got up subscription for herthe woman fortune be made spoke for one hour twenty five minute at anti slavery meeting at goat bootsthe enthusiasm be at height proposal be set on foot for presenting curate with piece of plate a mark of esteem for valuable service rendered to parish list of subscription be filled up in time contest be not who must escape contribution who must be foremost to subscribe splendid silver inkstand be made engraved with appropriate inscription curate be invited to public breakfast at before mentioned goat boot inkstand be presented in neat speech by mr gubbins ex churchwarden acknowledged by curate in term drew tear into eye of presentthe very waiter be melted one must have supposed that by time theme of universal admiration be lifted to very pinnacle of popularity such thing curate began to cough four fit of coughing one morning between litany epistle five in afternoon service here be discoverythe curate be consumptive how interestingly melancholy if young lady be energetic before sympathy solicitude now knew bound such man a curatesuch dearsuch perfect loveto be consumptive be too much anonymous present of black currant jam lozenge elastic waistcoat bosom friend warm stocking poured in upon curate until be a completely fitted out with winter clothing a if be on verge of expedition to north pole verbal bulletin of state of health be circulated throughout parish half dozen time day curate be in very zenith of popularity about period change came over spirit of parish very quiet respectable dozing old gentleman who have officiated in chapel of ease for twelve year previously died one fine morning without having given notice whatever of intention circumstance gave rise to counter sensation first arrival of successor occasioned counter sensation second be pale thin cadaverous man with large black eye long straggling black hair dress be slovenly in extreme manner ungainly doctrine startling in short be in respect antipode of curate crowd of female parishioner flocked to hear at first because be so odd looking then because face be so expressive then because preached so well at last because really thought that after there be something about be quite impossible to describe a to curate be very well certainly after there be denying thatthatin short curate wasnt novelty other clergyman be inconstancy of public opinion be proverbial congregation migrated one by one curate coughed till be black in faceit be in vain respired with difficultyit be equally ineffectual in awakening sympathy seat be once again to be have in part of parish church chapel of ease be going to be enlarged a be crowded to suffocation sunday best known most respected among parishioner be old lady who resided in parish long before name be registered in list of baptism parish be suburban one old lady life in neat row of house in most airy pleasant part of house be own everything about except old lady who look little older than did ten year ago be in just same state a when old gentleman be living little front parlour be old lady ordinary sitting room be perfect picture of quiet neatness carpet be covered with brown holland glass picture frame be carefully enveloped in yellow muslin table cover be never taken off except when leaf be turpentined bee waxed operation be regularly commenced other morning at half past nine oclockand little nicknack be always arranged in precisely same manner greater part of be present from little girl whose parent live in same row of such a two old fashioned watch never keep same time one being always quarter of hour too slow other quarter of hour too fast little picture of princess charlotte prince leopold a appeared in royal box at drury lane theatre others of same class have be in old lady possession for many year here old lady sits with spectacle on busily engaged in needleworknear window in summer time if see coming up step happen to be favourite trot out to open street door for before knock a must be fatigued after hot walk insists on swallowing two glass of sherry before exert by talking if call in evening will find cheerful rather more serious than usual with open bible on table before of sarah who be just a neat methodical a mistress regularly read two three chapter in parlour aloud old lady see scarcely company except little girl before noticed of whom have always regular fixed day for periodical tea drinking with to child look forward a greatest treat of existence seldom visit at greater distance than next door one on side when drink tea here sarah run out first knock double knock to prevent possibility of missis catching cold by having to wait at door be very scrupulous in returning little invitation when asks mr mr so so to meet mr mr somebody else sarah dust urn best china tea service pope joan board visitor be received in drawing room in great state have few relation be scattered about in different part of country seldom see have son in india whom always describes to a fine handsome fellowso like profile of poor dear father over sideboard old lady add with mournful shake of head that have always be one of greatest trial indeed once almost broke heart pleased god to enable to get better of must prefer never mentioning subject to again have great number of pensioner on saturday after come back from market there be regular levee of old men woman in passage waiting for weekly gratuity name always head list of benevolent subscription hers be always most liberal donation to winter coal soup distribution society subscribed twenty pound towards erection of organ in parish church be so overcome first sunday child sang to that be obliged to be carried out by pew opener entrance into church on sunday be always signal for little bustle in side aisle occasioned by general rise among poor people who bow curtsey until pew opener have ushered old lady into accustomed seat dropped respectful curtsey shut door same ceremony be repeated on leaving church when walk home with family next door one talk about sermon way invariably opening conversation by asking youngest boy where text be thus with annual variation of trip to quiet place on sea coast pass old lady life have rolled on in same unvarying benevolent course for many year now must at distant period be brought to final close look forward to termination with calmness without apprehension have everything to hope nothing to fear very different personage one who have rendered very conspicuous in parish be one of old lady next door neighbour be old naval officer on half pay bluff unceremonious behaviour disturbs old lady domestic economy not little in first place will smoke cigar in front court when want something to drink with themwhich be by mean uncommon circumstancehe lift up old lady knocker with walking stick demand to have glass of table ale handed over rail in addition to cool proceeding be bit of jack of trade to use own word regular robinson crusoe nothing delight better than to experimentalise on old lady property one morning got up early planted three four root of full grown marigold in bed of front garden to inconceivable astonishment of old lady who actually thought when got up looked out of window that be strange eruption have come out in night time took to piece eight day clock on front landing under pretence of cleaning work put together again by undiscovered process in so wonderful manner that large hand have done nothing trip up little one ever since then took to breeding silk worm must bring in two three time day in little paper box to show old lady generally dropping worm two at visit consequence be that one morning very stout silk worm be discovered in act of walking up stairsprobably with view of inquiring after friend for on further inspection appeared that of companion have already found way to room in house old lady went to seaside in despair during absence completely effaced name from brass door plate in attempt to polish with aqua fortis be nothing to seditious conduct in public life attends vestry meeting be held always opposes constituted authority of parish denounces profligacy of churchwarden contest legal point against vestry clerk will make tax gatherer call for money till wont call longer then sends find fault with sermon sunday say that organist ought to be ashamed of offer to back for amount to sing psalm better than child put together male female in short conduct in most turbulent uproarious manner worst of be that having high regard for old lady want to make convert to view therefore walk into little parlour with newspaper in hand talk violent politics by hour be charitable open hearted old fellow at bottom after so although put old lady little out occasionally agree very well in main laugh a much at feat of handiwork when be all over a anybody else chapter iiithe four sister row of house in old lady troublesome neighbour reside comprises beyond doubt greater number of character within circumscribed limit than rest of parish put together a can not consistently with present plan however extend number of parochial sketch beyond six will be better perhaps to select most peculiar to introduce at once without further preface four miss willis then settled in parish thirteen year ago be melancholy reflection that old adage time tide wait for man applies with equal force to fairer portion of creation willingly must conceal fact that even thirteen year ago miss willis be far from juvenile duty a faithful parochial chronicler however be paramount to other consideration be bound to state thirteen year since authority in matrimonial case considered youngest miss willis in very precarious state while eldest sister be positively given over a being far beyond human hope well miss willis took lease of house be fresh painted papered from top to bottom paint inside be wainscoted marble cleaned old grate taken down register stove must see to dress by put up four tree be planted in back garden several small basket of gravel sprinkled over front one van of elegant furniture arrived spring blind be fitted to window carpenter who have be employed in various preparation alteration repair made confidential statement to different maid servant in row relative to magnificent scale on miss willis be commencing maid servant told missis missis told friend vague rumour be circulated throughout parish that in gordon place have be taken by four maiden lady of immense property at last miss willis moved in then calling began house be perfection of neatnessso be four miss willis everything be formal stiff coldso be four miss willis not single chair of whole set be ever seen out of placenot single miss willis of whole four be ever seen out of hers there always sat in same place doing precisely same thing at same hour eldest miss willis used to knit second to draw two others to play duet on piano seemed to have separate existence to have made up mind just to winter through life together be three long grace in drapery with addition like school dinner of long grace afterwardsthe three fate with sisterthe siamese twin multiplied by two eldest miss willis grew biliousthe four miss willis grew bilious immediately eldest miss willis grew ill tempered religiousthe four miss willis be ill tempered religious directly whatever eldest did others did whatever anybody else did disapproved of thus vegetatedliving in polar harmony among a sometimes went out saw company in quiet way at home occasionally icing neighbour three year passed over in way when unlooked for extraordinary phenomenon occurred miss willis showed symptom of summer frost gradually broke up complete thaw took place be possible one of four miss willis be going to be married now where on earth husband came from by what feeling poor man must have be actuated by what process of reasoning four miss willis succeeded in persuading that be possible for man to marry one of without marrying be question too profound for to resolve certain be however that visit of mr robinson gentleman in public office with good salary little property of own besides be receivedthat four miss willis be courted in due form by said mr robinsonthat neighbour be perfectly frantic in anxiety to discover of four miss willis be fortunate fair that difficulty experienced in solving problem be not at lessened by announcement of eldest miss williswe be going to marry robinson be very extraordinary be so completely identified one with other that curiosity of whole roweven of old lady herselfwas roused almost beyond endurance subject be discussed at little card table tea drinking old gentleman of silk worm notoriety did not hesitate to express decided opinion that mr robinson be of eastern descent contemplated marrying whole family at once row generally shook head with considerable gravity declared business to be very mysterious hoped might end wellit certainly have very singular appearance still must be uncharitable to express opinion without good ground to go upon certainly miss willis be quite old enough to judge for to be sure people ought to know own business best so forth at last one fine morning at quarter before eight oclock be two glass coach drove up to miss willis door at mr robinson have arrived in cab ten minute before dressed in light blue coat double milled kersey pantaloon white neckerchief pump dress glove manner denoting a appeared from evidence of housemaid at who be sweeping door step at time considerable degree of nervous excitement be also hastily reported on same testimony that cook who opened door wore large white bow of unusual dimension in much smarter head dress than regulation cap to miss willis invariably restricted somewhat excursive taste of female servant in general intelligence spread rapidly from house to house be quite clear that eventful morning have at length arrived whole row stationed behind first second floor blind waited result in breathless expectation at last miss willis door opened door of first glass coach did same two gentleman pair of lady to correspondfriends of family doubt up went step went door off went first class coach up came second street door opened again excitement of whole row increasedmr robinson eldest miss willis thought so said lady at always other glass coach other glass coach have proceeded at brisk pace in direction of parish church who will depict perplexity of clergyman when miss willis knelt down at communion table repeated response incidental to marriage service in audible voiceor who will describe confusion prevailed wheneven after difficulty thus occasioned have be miss willis went into hysteric at conclusion of ceremony until sacred edifice resounded with united wailing a four sister mr robinson continued to occupy same house after memorable occasion a married sister whoever be never appeared in public without other three be not quite clear that neighbour ever must have discovered real mr robinson for circumstance of most gratifying description will happen occasionally in best regulated family three quarter day elapsed row on whom new light appeared to have be bursting for time began to speak with sort of implied confidence on subject to wonder how mr robinsonthe youngest miss willis wasgot on servant might be seen running up step about nine ten oclock morning with missis compliment wish to know how mr robinson find morning answer always be mr robinson compliment shes in very good spirit doesnt find worse piano be heard no longer knitting needle be laid aside drawing be neglected mantua making millinery on smallest scale imaginable appeared to have become favourite amusement of whole family parlour wasnt quite a tidy a used to be if called in morning must see lying on table with old newspaper carelessly thrown over two three particularly small cap rather larger than if have be made for moderate sized doll with small piece of lace in shape of horse shoe let in behind perhaps white robe not very large in circumference very much out of proportion in point of length with little tucker round top frill round bottom once when called saw long white roller with kind of blue margin down side probable use of be at loss to conjecture then fancied that dr dawson surgeon c who display large lamp with different colour in pane of glass at corner of row began to be knocked up at night oftener than used to be once be very much alarmed by hearing hackney coach stop at mr robinson door at past two oclock in morning out of there emerged fat old woman in cloak night cap with bundle in one hand pair of patten in other who looked a if have be suddenly knocked up out of bed for very special purpose when got up in morning saw that knocker be tied up in old white kid glove in innocence be in state of bachelorship then wondered what on earth meant until heard eldest miss willis in propri person say wonder have never occurred to what matter be before chapter ivthe election for beadle great event have recently occurred in parish contest of paramount interest have just terminated parochial convulsion have taken place have be succeeded by glorious triumph countryor at least parishit be samewill long remember have have election election for beadle supporter of old beadle system have be defeated in stronghold advocate of great new beadle principle have achieved proud victory parish like other parish be little world of own have long be divided into two party whose contention slumbering for while have never failed to burst forth with unabated vigour on occasion on must by possibility be renewed watching rate lighting rate paving rate sewer rate church rate poor ratesall sort of rate have be in turn subject of grand struggle a to question of patronage asperity determination with have be contested be scarcely credible leader of official partythe steady advocate of churchwarden unflinching supporter of overseersis old gentleman who life in row owns dozen house in always walk on opposite side of way so that may be able to take in view of whole of property at once be tall thin bony man with interrogative nose little restless perking eye appear to have be given for sole purpose of peeping into other people affair with be deeply impressed with importance of parish business pride not little on style of addressing parishioner in vestry assembled view be rather confined than extensive principle more narrow than liberal have be heard to declaim very loudly in favour of liberty of press advocate repeal of stamp duty on newspaper because daily journal who now have monopoly of public never give verbatim report of vestry meeting must not appear egotistical for world at same time must say that there be speechesthat celebrated speech of own on emolument of sexton duty of office for instancewhich might be communicated to public greatly to improvement advantage great opponent in public life be captain purday old naval officer on half pay to whom have already introduced reader captain being determined opponent of constituted authority whoever may chance to be other friend being steady supporter with equal disregard of individual merit will readily be supposed that occasion for coming into direct collision be few far between divided vestry fourteen time on motion for heating church with warm water instead of coal made speech about liberty expenditure prodigality hot water threw whole parish into state of excitement then captain when be on visiting committee opponent overseer brought forward certain distinct specific charge relative to management of workhouse boldly expressed total want of confidence in existing authority moved for copy of recipe by pauper soup be prepared together with document relating thereto overseer steadily resisted fortified by precedent appealed to established usage declined to produce paper on ground of injury must be done to public service if document of strictly private nature passing between master of workhouse cook be to be thus dragged to light on motion of individual member of vestry motion be lost by majority of two then captain who never allows to be defeated moved for committee of inquiry into whole subject affair grew serious question be discussed at meeting after meeting vestry after vestry speech be made attack repudiated personal defiance exchanged explanation received greatest excitement prevailed until at last just a question be going to be finally decided vestry found that somehow other have become entangled in point of form from be impossible to escape with propriety so motion be dropped everybody looked extremely important seemed quite satisfied with meritorious nature of whole proceeding be state of affair in parish week two since when simmons beadle suddenly died lamented deceased have over exerted day two previously in conveying aged female highly intoxicated to strong room of work house excitement thus occasioned added to severe cold indefatigable officer have caught in capacity of director of parish engine by inadvertently playing over instead of fire proved too much for constitution already enfeebled by age intelligence be conveyed to board one evening simmons have died left respect breath be scarcely out of body of deceased functionary when field be filled with competitor for vacant office of whom rested claim to public support entirely on number extent of family a if office of beadle be originally instituted a encouragement for propagation of human specie bung for beadle five small childrenhopkins for beadle seven small childrentimkins for beadle nine small child such be placard in large black letter on white ground be plentifully pasted on wall posted in window of principal shop timkinss success be considered certain several mother of family half promised vote nine small child must have run over course for production of placard announcing appearance of still more meritorious candidate spruggins for beadle ten small child two of twin wife there be resisting ten small child must have be almost irresistible in without twin touching parenthesis about interesting production of nature still more touching allusion to mr spruggins must ensure success spruggins be favourite at once appearance of lady a went about to solicit vote encouraged confident hope of still further addition to house of spruggins at remote period increased general prepossession in favour other candidate bung alone excepted resigned in despair day of election be fixed canvas proceeded with briskness perseverance on side member of vestry must not be supposed to escape contagious excitement inseparable from occasion majority of lady inhabitant of parish declared at once for spruggins quondam overseer took same side on ground that men with large family always have be elected to office that although must admit that in other respect spruggins be least qualified candidate of two still be old practice saw reason why old practice must be departed from be enough for captain immediately sided with bung canvassed for personally in direction wrote squib on spruggins got butcher to skewer up on conspicuous joint in shop front frightened neighbour old lady into palpitation of heart by awful denunciation of sprugginss party bounced in out up down backwards forward until sober inhabitant of parish thought inevitable that must die of brain fever long before election began day of election arrived be no longer individual struggle party contest between in out question be whether withering influence of overseer domination of churchwarden blighting despotism of vestry clerk must be allowed to render election of beadle forma nullity whether must impose vestry elected beadle on parish to do bidding forward view whether parishioner fearlessly asserting undoubted right must elect independent beadle of own nomination be fixed to take place in vestry so great be throng of anxious spectator that be found necessary to adjourn to church where ceremony commenced with due solemnity appearance of churchwarden overseer ex churchwarden ex overseer with spruggins in rear excited general attention spruggins be little thin man in rusty black with long pale face countenance expressive of care fatigue might either be attributed to extent of family anxiety of feeling opponent appeared in cast off coat of captainsa blue coat with bright button white trouser description of shoe familiarly known by appellation of high low there be serenity in open countenance of bunga kind of moral dignity in confident airan wish may get sort of expression in eyewhich infused animation into supporter evidently dispirited opponent ex churchwarden rose to propose thomas spruggins for beadle have known long have have eye upon closely for year have watched with twofold vigilance for month parishioner here suggested that might be termed taking double sight observation be drowned in loud cry of order must repeat that have have eye upon for year must say that more well conducted more well behaved more sober more quiet man with more well regulated mind have never met with man with larger family have never known cheer parish required man who must be depended on hear from spruggins side answered by ironical cheer from bung party such man now proposed yes must not allude to individual ex churchwarden continued in celebrated negative style adopted by great speaker must not advert to gentleman who have once held high rank in service of majesty must not say that gentleman be gentleman must not assert that man be man must not say that be turbulent parishioner must not say that have grossly misbehaved not only on on former occasion must not say that be one of discontented treasonable spirit who carried confusion disorder wherever went must not say that harboured in heart envy hatred malice uncharitableness wished to have everything comfortable pleasant therefore must saynothing about cheer captain replied in similar parliamentary style must not say be astonished at speech have just heard must not say be disgusted cheer must not retort epithet have be hurled against renewed cheering must not allude to men once in office now happily out of who have mismanaged workhouse ground pauper diluted beer slack baked bread boned meat heightened work lowered soup tremendous cheer must not ask what such men deserved voice nothing day find must not say that one burst of general indignation must drive from parish polluted with presence give must not allude to unfortunate man who have be proposedhe must not say a vestry tool a beadle must not advert to individual family must not say that nine child twin wife be very bad example for pauper imitation loud cheer must not advert in detail to qualification of bung man stood before must not say in presence what might be disposed to say of if be absent here mr bung telegraphed to friend near under cover of hat by contracting left eye applying right thumb to tip of nose have be objected to bung that have only five child hear hear from opposition well have yet to learn that legislature have affixed precise amount of infantine qualification to office of beadle taking for granted that extensive family be great requisite entreated to look to fact compare data about there must be mistake bung be year of age sprugginsof whom wished to speak with possible respectwas be not more than possiblewas not very probablethat by time bung attained latter age might see around family even exceeding in number extent that to spruggins at present laid claim deafening cheer waving of captain concluded amidst loud applause by calling upon parishioner to sound tocsin rush to poll free from dictation be slave for ever on following day polling began never have have bustle in parish since got up famous anti slavery examination be going fast to decay chapter viiour next door neighbour be very fond of speculating a walk through street on character pursuit of people who inhabit nothing so materially assist in speculation a appearance of house door various expression of human countenance afford beautiful interesting study there be something in physiognomy of street door knocker almost a characteristic nearly a infallible whenever visit man for first time contemplate feature of knocker with greatest curiosity for well know between man knocker there will inevitably be greater le degree of resemblance sympathy for instance there be one description of knocker used to be common enough be fast passing awaya large round one with jolly face of convivial lion smiling blandly at a twist side of hair into curl pull up shirt collar while be waiting for door to be opened never saw that knocker on door of churlish manso far a experience be concerned invariably bespoke hospitality bottle man ever saw knocker on door of small attorney bill broker always patronise other lion heavy ferocious looking fellow with countenance expressive of savage stupiditya sort of grand master among knocker great favourite with selfish brutal then there be little pert egyptian knocker with long thin face pinched up nose very sharp chin be most in vogue with government office people in light drab starched cravat little spare priggish men who be perfectly satisfied with own opinion consider of paramount importance be greatly troubled few year ago by innovation of new kind of knocker without face at composed of wreath depending from hand small truncheon little trouble attention however enabled to overcome difficulty to reconcile new system to favourite theory will invariably find knocker on door of cold formal people who always ask why dont come never say do everybody know brass knocker be common to suburban villa extensive boarding school having noticed genus have recapitulated most prominent strongly defined specie phrenologist affirm that agitation of man brain by different passion produce corresponding development in form of skull let be understood a pushing theory to full length of asserting that alteration in man disposition must produce visible effect on feature of knocker position merely be that in case magnetism must exist between man knocker must induce man to remove seek knocker more congenial to altered feeling if ever find man changing habitation without reasonable pretext depend upon that although may not be aware of fact be because knocker be at variance be new theory venture to launch nevertheless a being quite a ingenious infallible a many thousand of learned speculation be daily broached for public good private fortune making entertaining feeling on subject of knocker will be readily imagined with what consternation viewed entire removal of knocker from door of next house to one lived in time ago substitution of bell be calamity have never anticipated bare idea of anybody being able to exist without knocker appeared so wild visionary that have never for one instant entered imagination sauntered moodily from spot bent step towards eaton square then just building what be astonishment indignation to find that bell be fast becoming rule knocker exception theory trembled beneath shock hastened home fancying foresaw in swift progress of event entire abolition resolved from day forward to vent speculation on next door neighbour in person house adjoining ours on left hand be uninhabited have therefore plenty of leisure to observe next door neighbour on other side house without knocker be in occupation of city clerk there be neatly written bill in parlour window intimating lodging for single gentleman be to be let gentleman who be very good lodger in other respect notice to quit single gentleman went away entertained friend in other lodging next applicant for vacant first floor be of very different character from troublesome single gentleman who have just quitted be tall thin young gentleman with profusion of brown hair reddish whisker very slightly developed moustache wore braided surtout with frog of about fifty might be le mother wore widow weed boy be also clothed in deep mourning be poorvery poor for only mean of support arose from pittance boy earned by copying writing translating for bookseller have removed from country place settled in london partly because afforded better chance of employment for boy partly perhaps with natural desire to leave place where have be in better circumstance where poverty be known be proud under revers above revealing want privation to stranger how bitter privation be how hard boy worked to remove one ever knew night after night two three four hour after midnight must hear occasional raking up of scanty fire hollow half stifled cough indicated being still at work day after day must see more plainly that nature have set that unearthly light in plaintive face be beacon of worst disease actuated hope by higher feeling than mere curiosity contrived to establish first acquaintance then close intimacy with poor stranger worst fear be realised boy be sinking fast through part of winter whole of following spring summer labour be unceasingly prolonged mother attempted to procure needle work embroideryanything for bread few shilling now then be must earn boy worked steadily on dying by minute never once giving utterance to complaint murmur one beautiful autumn evening went to pay customary visit to invalid little remaining strength have be decreasing rapidly for two three day preceding be lying on sofa at open window gazing at setting sun mother have be reading bible to for closed book a entered advanced to meet be telling william said that must manage to take into country somewhere so that may get quite well be not ill know be not very strong have exerted too much lately poor thing tear streamed through finger form before at respiration heart beat more slowly boy placed one hand in ours grasped mother arm with other drew hastily towards fervently kissed cheek there be pause sunk back upon pillow looked long earnestly in mother face william william murmured mother after long interval dont look at sospeak to dear boy smiled languidly instant afterwards feature resolved into same cold solemn gaze william ivscotland yard scotland yard be smalla very small tract of land bounded on one side by river thames on other by garden of northumberland house abutting at one end on bottom of northumberland street at other on back of whitehall place when territory be first accidentally discovered by country gentleman who lost way in strand year ago original settler be found to be tailor publican two eating house keeper fruit pie maker be also found to contain race of strong bulky men who repaired to wharf in scotland yard regularly morning about five six oclock to fill heavy waggon with coal with proceeded to distant place up country supplied inhabitant with fuel when have emptied waggon again returned for fresh supply trade be continued throughout year a settler derived subsistence from ministering to want of primitive trader article exposed for sale place where be sold bore strong outward mark of being expressly adapted to taste wish tailor displayed in window lilliputian pair of leather gaiter diminutive round frock while doorpost be appropriately garnished with model of coal sack two eating house keeper exhibited joint of magnitude pudding of solidity coalheavers alone must appreciate fruit pie maker displayed on well scrubbed window board large white composition of flour dripping ornamented with pink stain giving rich promise of fruit within made huge mouth water a lingered past choicest spot in scotland yard be old public house in corner here in dark wainscoted room of ancient appearance cheered by glow of mighty fire decorated with enormous clock whereof face be white figure black sat lusty coalheavers quaffing large draught of barclays best puffing forth volume of smoke wreathed heavily above head involved room in thick dark cloud from apartment might voice be heard on winter night penetrating to very bank of river a shouted out sturdy chorus roared forth burden of popular song dwelling upon last few word with strength length of emphasis made very roof tremble above here too must tell old legend of what thames be in ancient time when patent shot manufactory wasnt built waterloo bridge have never be thought of then must shake head with portentous look to deep edification of rising generation of heaver who crowded round wondered where must end whereat tailor must take pipe solemnly from mouth say how that hoped might end well very much doubted whether must not couldnt rightly tell what to make of ita mysterious expression of opinion delivered with semi prophetic air never failed to elicit fullest concurrence of assembled company so must go on drinking wondering till ten oclock came with tailor wife to fetch home when little party broke up to meet again in same room say do precisely same thing on following evening at same hour about time barge came up river began to bring vague rumour to scotland yard of somebody in city having be heard to say that lord mayor have threatened in so many word to pull down old london bridge build up new one at first rumour be disregarded a idle tale wholly destitute of foundation for nobody in scotland yard doubted that if lord mayor contemplated such dark design must just be clapped up in tower for week two then killed off for high treason by degree however report grew stronger more frequent at last barge laden with numerous chaldron of best wallsend brought up positive intelligence that several of arch of old bridge be stopped that preparation be actually in progress for constructing new one what excitement be visible in old tap room on memorable night man looked into neighbour face pale with alarm astonishment read therein echo of sentiment filled own breast oldest heaver present proved to demonstration that moment pier be removed water in thames must run clean off leave dry gully in place what be to become of coal bargesof trade of scotland yardof very existence of population tailor shook head more sagely than usual grimly pointing to knife on table bid wait see what happened said nothingnot if lord mayor didnt fall victim to popular indignation why must be rather astonished that be did wait barge after barge arrived still tidings of assassination of lord mayor first stone be laid be done by dukethe king brother year passed away bridge be opened by king in course of time pier be removed when people in scotland yard got up next morning in confident expectation of being able to step over to pedlar acre without wetting sol of shoe found to unspeakable astonishment that water be just where used to be result so different from have anticipated from first improvement produced full effect upon inhabitant of scotland yard one of eating house keeper began to court public opinion to look for customer among new class of people covered little dining table with white cloth got painter apprentice to inscribe something about hot joint from twelve to two in one of little pane of shop window improvement began to march with rapid of common metropolitan representative found near cut many other foot passenger followed example marked advance of civilisation beheld with sigh eating house keeper who manfully resisted innovation of affecting to know such philanthropy be imperfectly rewarded bow street newgate millbank be poor return for general benevolence evincing in irrepressible love for created object mr barker felt so after soila peaceful pursuit in term of seven year glided almost imperceptibly away whether at expiration of period have just mentioned british government required mr barker presence here did not require nearest to door be probably aware of approach have assumed air of courageous indifference face be purposely averted towards window stirred not inch while be present other two men be at upper end of room one of who be imperfectly seen in dim light have back towards be stooping over fire with right arm on mantel piece head sunk upon other be leaning on sill of farthest window light fell full upon communicated to pale haggard face disordered hair appearance at distance be ghastly cheek rested upon hand with face little raised eye wildly staring before seemed to be unconsciously intent on counting chink in opposite wall passed room again afterwards first man be pacing up down court with firm military stephe have be soldier in foot guardsand cloth cap jauntily thrown on one side of head bowed respectfully to conductor salute be returned other two still remained in position have described be a motionless a statue few pace up yard forming continuation of building in be two room have just quitted condemned cell entrance be by narrow obscure stair case leading to dark passage in charcoal stove cast lurid tint over object in immediate vicinity diffuses something like warmth around from left hand side of passage massive door of cell on story open from alone can be approached there be three of passage three of range of cell one above other in size furniture appearance be precisely alike prior to recorder report being made prisoner under sentence of death be removed from day room at five oclock in afternoon locked up in cell where be allowed candle until ten oclock here remain until seven next morning when warrant for prisoner execution arrives be removed to cell confined in one of until leaf for scaffold be at liberty to walk in yard in walk in cell be constantly attended by turnkey who never leaf on pretence entered first cell be stone dungeon eight foot long by six wide with bench at upper end under be common rug bible prayer book iron candlestick be fixed into wall at side small high window in back admitted a much air light a must struggle in between double row of heavy crossed iron bar contained other furniture of description conceive situation of man spending last night on earth in cell buoyed up with vague undefined hope of reprieve knew not whyindulging in wild visionary idea of escaping knew not howhour after hour of three preceding day allowed for preparation have fled with speed man living must deem possible for none dying man can know have wearied friend with entreaty exhausted attendant with importunity neglected in feverish restlessness timely warning of spiritual consoler now that illusion be at last dispelled now that eternity be before guilt behind now that fear of death amount almost to madness overwhelming sense of helpless hopeless state rush upon be lost stupefied have thought to turn to power to call upon almighty being from whom alone can seek mercy forgiveness before whom repentance can alone avail hour have glided by still sits upon same stone bench with folded arm heedless alike of fast decreasing time before urgent entreaty of good man at side feeble light be wasting gradually deathlike augustus cooper went back lived with mother there life to day a have lost ambition for society never go into world will never see account of will never be wiser chapter xshabby genteel people there be certain description of people who oddly enough appear to appertain exclusively to metropolis meet day in street of london one ever encounter elsewhere seem indigenous to soil to belong a exclusively to london a own smoke dingy brick mortar must illustrate remark by variety of example in present sketch will only advert to one class a specimenthat class be so aptly expressively designated a shabby genteel now shabby people god know may be found anywhere genteel people be not article of greater scarcity out of london than in compound of twothis shabby gentilityis a purely local a statue at charing cross pump at aldgate be worthy of remark too that only men be shabby genteel woman be always either dirty slovenly in extreme neat respectable however poverty stricken in appearance very poor man who have seen better day a phrase go be strange compound of dirty slovenliness wretched attempt at faded smartness will endeavour to explain conception of term form title of paper if meet man lounging up drury lane leaning with back against post in long acre with hand in pocket of pair of drab trouser plentifully besprinkled with grease spot trouser made very full over boot ornamented with two cord down outside of legwearing also what have be brown coat with bright button hat very much pinched up at side cocked over right eyedont pity be not shabby genteel harmonic meeting at fourth rate public house purlieu of private theatre be chosen haunt entertains rooted antipathy to kind of work be on familiar term with several pantomime men at large house if see hurrying along by street keeping a close a can to area railing man of about forty fifty clad in old rusty suit of threadbare black cloth shine with constant wear a if have be bee waxedthe trouser tightly strapped down partly for look of thing partly to keep old shoe from slipping off at heelsif observe too that yellowish white neckerchief be carefully pinned up to conceal tattered garment underneath that hand be encased in remains of old pair of beaver glove may set down a shabby genteel man glance at depressed face timorous air of conscious poverty will make heart achealways supposing that be neither philosopher political economist be once haunted by shabby genteel man be bodily present to sens day be in mind eye night man of whom sir walter scott speaks in demonology did not suffer persecution from imaginary always have before couple of shabby genteel bookstwo old dog eared folio in mouldy worm eaten cover have once be smart be in chair morning just a clock struck be always last to leave room in afternoon when did quitted with air of man who knew not where else to go for warmth quiet there used to sit day a close to table a possible in order to conceal lack of button on coat with old hat carefully deposited at foot where evidently flattered escaped observation about two oclock must see munching french roll penny loaf not taking boldly out of pocket at once like man who knew be only making lunch breaking off little bit in pocket eating by stealth knew too well be dinner when first saw poor object thought quite impossible that attire must ever become worse even went so far a to speculate on possibility of shortly appearing in decent second hand suit knew nothing about matter grew more more shabby genteel day button dropped off waistcoat one by one then buttoned coat when one side of coat be reduced to same condition a waistcoat buttoned overon other side looked somewhat better at beginning of week than at conclusion because neckerchief though yellow be not quite so dingy in midst of wretchedness never appeared without glove strap remained in state for week two at length one of button on back of coat fell off then man disappeared thought be dead be sitting at same table about week after disappearance a eye rested on vacant chair insensibly fell into train of meditation on subject of retirement from public life be wondering whether have hung thrown off bridgewhether really be dead have only be arrestedwhen conjecture be suddenly set at rest by entry of man have strange metamorphosis walked up centre of room with air showed be fully conscious of improvement in appearance be very odd clothes be fine deep glossy black yet looked like same suit nay there be very darn with old acquaintance have made familiar hat toonobody must mistake shape of hat with high crown gradually increasing in circumference towards top long service have imparted to reddish brown tint now be a black a coat truth flashed suddenly upon usthey have be revived be deceitful liquid black blue reviver have watched effect on many shabby genteel man betrays victim into temporary assumption of importance possibly into purchase of new pair of glove cheap stock other trifling article of dress elevates spirit for week only to depress if possible below original level be so in case transient dignity of unhappy man decreased in exact proportion a reviver wore off knee of unmentionable elbow of coat seam generally soon began to get alarmingly white hat be once more deposited under table owner crept into seat a quietly a ever there be week of incessant small rain mist at expiration reviver have entirely vanished shabby genteel man never afterwards attempted to effect improvement in outward appearance must be difficult to name particular part of town a principal resort of shabby genteel men have met great many person of description in neighbourhood of inn of court may be met with in holborn between eight ten morning have curiosity to enter insolvent debtor court will observe among spectator practitioner great variety of never went on change by chance without seeing shabby genteel men have often wondered what earthly business can have there will sit there for hour leaning on great dropsical mildewed umbrella eating abernethy biscuit nobody speaks to to one on consideration remember to have occasionally seen two shabby genteel men conversing together on change experience assures that be uncommon circumstance occasioned by offer of pinch of snuff such civility must be task of equal difficulty to assign particular spot for residence of being to endeavour to enumerate general occupation be never engaged in business with more than one shabby genteel man be drunken engraver lived in damp back parlour in new row of house at camden town half street half brick field somewhere near canal shabby genteel man may have occupation may be corn agent coal agent wine merchant collector of debt broker assistant broken down attorney may be clerk of lowest description contributor to press of same grade whether reader have noticed men in walk a often a have know not knowthat miserably poor man matter whether owes distress to own conduct that of others who feel poverty vainly strives to conceal be one of most pitiable object in human nature such object with few exception be shabby genteel people chapter ximaking night of damon pythia be undoubtedly very good place of public fashionable resort mr potter mr smithers have mutually agreed that on receipt of quarter salary must jointly in company spend eveningan evident misnomerthe spending applying a everybody know not to evening to money individual may chance to be possessed of on occasion to reference be made have likewise agreed that on evening aforesaid must make night of itan expressive term implying borrowing of several hour from to morrow morning adding to night before manufacturing compound night of whole quarter day arrived at lastwe say at last because quarter day be a eccentric a term have never since be detected in making night of chapter xiithe prisoner van be passing corner of bow street on return from lounging excursion other afternoon when crowd assembled round door of police office attracted attention turned up street accordingly there be thirty forty people standing on pavement half across road few straggler be patiently stationed on opposite side of wayall evidently waiting in expectation of arrival waited too few minute nothing occurred so turned round to unshorn sallow looking cobbler who be standing next with hand under bib of apron put usual question of whats matter cobbler eyed from head to foot with superlative contempt laconically replied nuffin now be perfectly aware that if two men stop in street to look at given object even to gaze in air two hundred men will be assembled in time a knew very well that crowd of people must by possibility remain in street for five minute without getting up little amusement among unless have absorbing object in view natural inquiry next in order be what be people waiting here forher majesty carriage replied cobbler be still more extraordinary must not imagine what earthly business majesty carriage must have at public office bow street be beginning to ruminate on possible cause of such uncommon appearance when general exclamation from boy in crowd of here wan caused to raise head look up street covered vehicle in prisoner be conveyed from police office to different prison be coming along at full speed then occurred to for first time that majesty carriage be merely name for prisoner van conferred upon not only by reason of superior gentility of term because aforesaid van be maintained at majesty expense having be originally started for exclusive accommodation of lady gentleman through friend cobbler other straggler crossed over followed example driver man who have be seated by side in front of vehicle dismounted be admitted into office office door be closed after crowd be on tiptoe of expectation after few minute delay door again opened two first prisoner appeared be couple of girl of whom eldercould not be more than sixteen younger of whom have certainly not attained seared be gaudily dressed younger one especially although there be strong similarity between in respect be rendered more obvious by being handcuffed together be impossible to conceive greater contrast than demeanour of two presented younger girl be weeping bitterlynot for display in hope of producing effect for very shame face be buried in handkerchief whole manner be too expressive of bitter unavailing sorrow how long be for emily screamed red faced woman in crowd six week labour replied elder girl with flaunting laugh thats better than stone jug anyhow mill deal better than session here repulsive in course friendless forlorn unpitied at miserable conclusion there be other prisonersboys of ten a hardened in vice a men of fiftya houseless vagrant going joyfully to prison a place of went mr tibbs used to say with air of great importance that be engaged in city miss maplesones accomplished parent arrived in course of afternoon in hackney coach accompanied by most astonishing number of package trunk bonnet box muff box parasol guitar case parcel of imaginable shape done up in brown paper fastened with pin filled passage then there be such running up down with luggage such mr septimus hick who be tallish white faced young man with spectacle black ribbon round neck instead of neckerchiefa most interesting person poetical walker of hospital very talented young man be fond of lugging into conversation sort of quotation from don juan without fettering by propriety of application in particular be remarkably independent other mr simpson be one of young men who be in quotation in inverted comma chapter iimr minns cousin mr augustus minns be bachelor of about forty a saidof about eight forty a friend said be always exceedingly clean precise tidy perhaps somewhat priggish most retiring man in world usually wore brown frock coat without wrinkle light inexplicables without spot neat neckerchief with remarkably neat tie boot without fault moreover always carried quarter a regularly countermanding on second there be two class of created object held in deepest most unmingled horror be dog child be not unamiable must at time have viewed execution of dog personage very upright very yellow miss amelia crumpton owned to thirty eight miss maria crumpton admitted be forty admission be rendered perfectly unnecessary by self evident fact of being at least ivthe tuggses at ramsgate once upon time there dwelt in narrow street on surrey side of water within three minute walk of old london bridge mr joseph tuggsa little dark faced man with shiny hair twinkling eye short leg body of very considerable thickness measuring from centre button of waistcoat in front to ornamental button of coat behind figure of amiable mr tuggs if not perfectly symmetrical be decidedly comfortable form of only daughter accomplished miss charlotte tuggs be fast ripening into state of luxuriant plumpness have enchanted eye captivated heart of mr joseph tuggs in earlier day mr simon tuggs only son miss charlotte tuggss only brother be a differently formed in body a be differently constituted in mind from remainder of family there be elongation in thoughtful face tendency to weakness in interesting leg tell so forcibly of great mind romantic disposition slightest trait of character in such being posse mean interest to speculative mind usually appeared in public in capacious shoe with black cotton stocking be observed to be particularly attached to black glazed stock without tie ornament of description there be perhaps profession however useful pursuit however meritorious can escape petty attack of vulgar mind mr joseph tuggs be grocer might be supposed that grocer be beyond breath of calumny nothe neighbour stigmatised a chandler poisonous voice of envy distinctly asserted that dispensed tea coffee by quartern retailed sugar by ounce cheese by slice tobacco by screw butter by pat taunt however be lost upon tuggses mr tuggs attended to grocery department mr tuggs to cheesemongery miss tuggs to education mr simon tuggs kept father book own counsel one fine spring afternoon latter gentleman be seated on tub of weekly agile somewhat alarming manner abrupt termination to rapidity of ride naturally occasioned confusion lady indulged in vehement screaming for several minute mr cymon tuggs besides sustaining intense that somewhat eccentric gentleman armed with walking stick of gigantic dimension repaired with usual equanimity of manner to mr trotts apartment entered without ceremony mounted guard in by quietly depositing on chair near door where proceeded to beguile time by whistling popular air with great apparent satisfaction what do want here scoundrel exclaimed mr alexander trott with proper appearance of indignation at detention boot beat time with head a looked gently round at mr trott with smile of pity whistled adagio movement do attend in room by mr overtons desire inquired trott rather to fight duel if theyd let protest against being kept here deny have intention of fighting with anybody a useless contending with superior number will sit quietly down youd better observed placid boot shaking large stick expressively under protest however added alexander trott seating with indignation in face great content in heart under protest oh certainly responded boot anything please if youre happy im transported only dont talk too muchitll make worse make worse exclaimed trott in unfeigned astonishment man drunk youd better be quiet young feller remarked boot going through threatening new score leave ere bell alone wretched loo nattic said boot suddenly forcing unfortunate trott back into chair brandishing stick aloft be quiet miserable object dont let everybody know there madman in house be madman be madman exclaimed terrified mr trott gazing on one eye of red headed boot with look of abject horror madman replied boot damme think be madman with vengeance listen to unfortunate kept solitary organ of vision constantly fixed on mr alexander trott unfortunate individual stared at companion in turn until feature grew more more indistincthis hair gradually le redand room more say that there be scarcely man in constant habit of walking day after day through of crowded thoroughfare of london who can not recollect among people whom know by sight to use familiar phrase being loved sorrow slowly consumes will not break heart have driven wild present hideous spectacle of madman slowly dying by own hand by far greater part have wilfully with open eye plunged into gulf from man who once enters never rise more into sink deeper deeper down until recovery be hopeless such man a once stood by bedside of dying wife while child knelt around mingled loud burst of grief with there have long since mouldered away sketch of young gentleman to young lady of united kingdom of great britain ireland also young lady of principality of wale likewise young lady resident in isle of guernsey jersey alderney sark humble dedication of devoted admirer sheweth that dedicator have perused with feeling of virtuous indignation work purporting to be sketch of young lady written by quiz illustrated by phiz published in one volume square twelvemo after attentive vigilant perusal of said work dedicator be humbly of opinion that so many libel upon honourable sex be never contained in previously published work in twelvemo other mo that in title page preface to said work honourable sex be described classified a animal although dedicator be not at present prepared to deny that be animal still humbly submits that be not polite to call so that in aforesaid preface honourable sex be also described a troglodites being hard word may for aught honourable sex dedicator can say to contrary be injurious disrespectful appellation that author of said work applied to task in malice prepense with wickedness aforethought fact dedicator contends be sufficiently demonstrated by assuming name of quiz dedicator submits denotes foregone conclusion implies intention of quizzing that in execution of evil design said quiz author of said work must have betrayed trust confidence reposed in by member of honourable sex otherwise never must have acquired so much information relative to manner custom of honourable sex in general that actuated by consideration further moved by various slander insinuation respecting honourable sex contained in said work square twelvemo entitled sketch of young lady dedicator venture to produce work square twelvemo entitled sketch of young gentleman of now solicits acceptance approval a young lady be best companion of young gentleman so young gentleman must be best companion of young lady extending comparison from animal to quote disrespectful language of said quiz to inanimate object dedicator humbly suggests that such of honourable sex a purchased bane must posse of antidote that of honourable sex who be not rash enough to take first must lose time in swallowing lastprevention being in case better than cure a be informed upon authority not only of general acknowledgment also of traditionary wisdom that with reference to said bane antidote dedicator have further remark to make than be comprised in printed direction issued with doctor morisons pill namely that whenever honourable sex take twenty five of number will be pleased to take fifty of number without delay dedicator will ever pray c bashful young gentleman found seated at small dinner party other day opposite stranger of such singular appearance manner that irresistibly attracted attention be fresh coloured young gentleman with a good promise of light whisker a one might wish to see possessed of very velvet like soft looking countenance use latter term invidiously merely to denote pair of smooth plump highly coloured cheek of capacious dimension mouth rather remarkable for fresh hue of lip than for marked striking expression presented whole face be suffused with crimson blush bore that downcast timid retiring look betokens man ill at ease with there be nothing in symptom to attract more than passing remark attention have be originally drawn to
